action.action-desc: Mr. Budd introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Securities Act of 1933 to add additional investment thresholds for an individual to qualify as an accredited investor, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Investment Opportunity Expansion Act.

section.header: Investment thresholds to qualify as an accredited investor
section.text: Section 2(a)(15) of the Securities Act of 1933 (15 U.S.C. 77b(a)(15)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in clause (i), by striking or at the end;
in clause (ii), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: with respect to a proposed transaction, any individual whose aggregate investment, at the completion of such transaction, in securities with respect to which there has not been a public offering is not more than 10 percent of the greater of—

subclause.text: the net assets of the individual; or
the annual income of the individual.
